availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph H. Sidebottom (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier in the 33rd and 26th KY)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Felix Sidebottom and Fanny Sidebottom. Married to Amanda Frances Chelds Sidebottom in Green County, Kentucky, on December 2, 1858. Father of Felix J. Sidebottom. Student in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in Company D 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from September 13, 1862, to April 1, 1864. Served in Company K 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from April 1, 1864, to March 27, 1865. Died in a field hospital near Moseley Hill, North Carolina, of apoplexy on March 27, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994036, Green County Marriages.

U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #99353, Certificate #146849.
